title: 'File case, do what you want': Rahul reiterates Trump pressure on PM Modi
content: Rahul Gandhi said the Modi government's decision to import American "corn, soybeans, and fruits" is just a beginning and that the Centre would "open the doors of the entire agriculture market‚Äã‚Äã for his friends, for people like Adani and Ambani, and for foreign powers." He reiterated his "PM Modi has sold the nation" remark.

title: 'Incorrect & speculative': AAIB pans Italian report blaming pilot for AI171 crash
content: The Aircraft Accident Investigation Bureau (AAIB) has clarified that the investigation into the June 2025 Air India Flight AI-171 crash in Ahmedabad is ongoing, refuting reports of conclusions that balmed the pilot for the incident. The AAIB emphasized that investigations are technical and evidence-based, with the final report to be published upon completion, dismissing speculative foreign media claims.

title: Bridge over troubled waters: Trump‚Äôs trade turbulence casts shadow on US-India Deal
content: US Congress is challenging President Trump's trade tariff powers, with a House vote against Canada tariffs and an impending Supreme Court ruling on emergency trade authority. This uncertainty, coupled with Trump's unpredictable demands, raises serious doubts about the stability of the new US-India trade framework, suggesting even signed deals might be temporary.

title: After CEO asked employees to stop coding, Nvidia engineers get access to OpenAI's Codex
content: Nvidia has equipped all 30,000 engineers with OpenAI's advanced AI coding tool, Codex, a significant enterprise rollout.  This move aligns with CEO Jensen Huang's vision to automate tasks, freeing engineers to focus on problem-solving.  Engineers are reportedly impressed with Codex's ability to maintain context during complex coding sessions, highlighting its efficiency and advanced capabilities.

title: B'desh elections: Hasina labels polls a farce, demands 'fresh vote'; targets Yunus
content: Bangladesh's Awami League has denounced the recent parliamentary election as a staged charade, asserting it violated democratic principles and the constitution. The party claims widespread voter apathy, intimidation, and ballot stuffing marred the process. They are demanding the election's annulment, the chief advisor's resignation, and fresh polls under a neutral government to reinstate citizens' voting rights.

title: Ishan Kishan becomes first Indian keeper to accomplish this T20 WC record
content: Ishan Kishan made history by becoming the first Indian wicketkeeper to score a fifty in a T20 World Cup, blasting 61 off 24 balls against Namibia at the Arun Jaitley Stadium. His knock helped India post 209/9, with Hardik Pandya adding 52 and useful contributions from Sanju Samson, Tilak Varma and Shivam Dube.

title: In a First, Elon Musk‚Äôs company posts 45-minute all-hands after co-founder exit
content: Elon Musk's xAI has unveiled significant internal shifts, including employee departures and a new four-team structure focused on Grok, coding, video generation, and a 'Macrohard' project.  The company also reported substantial revenue and impressive AI-generated content figures, alongside Musk's bold vision for space-based AI infrastructure and lunar operations.

title: From braille to bench: Thanya Nathan to become Kerala‚Äôs first visually impaired judge
content: Thanya Nathan, a trailblazing law graduate with visual impairment, has shattered barriers by emerging as the top candidate in Kerala's Civil Judge (Junior Division) exam for the disabled category. Drawing motivation from a pivotal Supreme Court ruling, she effectively harnessed assistive technologies and Braille in her studies.

title: Dead-ball drama! Umpire intervenes, bowler forced to re-bowl in India vs Namibia match
content: A bizarre delivery from Namibia's captain Gerhard Erasmus during their T20 World Cup clash against India in Delhi caused a stir, leading to a dead ball call and a disagreement with the umpire. India, bolstered by the return of Sanju Samson and Jasprit Bumrah, aimed to defend their total after winning the toss.

title: Google DeepMind CEO Demis Hassabis talks about his sleep routine that he agrees is unusual
content: Google DeepMind CEO Demis Hassabis revealed his unconventional sleep schedule, aiming for six hours and dividing his day into two work periods. He works late into the night for creative thinking, despite warning others about the dangers of insufficient sleep. This demanding routine has been a part of his life for a decade as he leads the AI lab.

title: Record! Italy batters become first-ever pair to achieve this feat
content: Italy made history at the T20 World Cup as brothers Justin and Anthony Mosca powered them to their first-ever World Cup win with a 10-wicket thrashing of Nepal. After restricting Nepal to 123, the duo chased it with an unbeaten 124-run opening stand, setting a record for the highest sibling partnership in T20 World Cup history.

title: Watch: Rahul Gandhi snaps at reporters outside Parliament; Rijiju questions his stance
content: A political storm brewed in Parliament as Rahul Gandhi confronted journalists over privilege motion queries, sparking BJP criticism. This follows his strong Lok Sabha attack on the government. Union Minister Kiren Rijiju accused Gandhi of avoiding questions and shared a video of alleged misconduct in the Speaker's chamber, which Priyanka Gandhi Vadra denied.

title: Will BTS take over from Bad Bunny? Inside the Super Bowl 2027 halftime race
content: Bad Bunny just turned Super Bowl LX into a global Spanish-language flex. Now Super Bowl LXI heads to SoFi Stadium on Feb. 14, 2027, and the NFL has a problem: who can possibly top that? From BTS and a full K-Pop spectacle to Taylor Swift, Justin Bieber and Jay-Z, here is the real early shortlist.

title: 'Neither my language nor my voice': Tharoor flags fake AI video claiming he praised Pakistan
content: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor has slammed a fabricated AI-generated video falsely attributing praise for Pakistan's diplomatic handling of a T20 World Cup boycott to him. Tharoor clarified the video was fake, stating neither the language nor voice was his, and had previously called Pakistan's boycott "disgraceful."

title: T20 World Cup: Sanju Samson trolled online after Namibia show - 'One more chance wasted'
content: Sanju Samson was trolled on social media after scoring 22 off 8 balls against Namibia in the T20 World Cup, with fans saying he wasted another chance. He played in place of Abhishek Sharma, who was ill. Namibia chose to bowl on a flat pitch, while Suryakumar Yadav spoke about dew and team changes. Despite criticism, India started strongly, but Samson‚Äôs dismissal reignited consistency debates.

title: 'Negotiations under way': Rajpal Yadav has paid half amount of debt, says his lawyer
content: Actor Rajpal Yadav's lawyer reports that half of the outstanding amount in his insolvency case has been cleared. A bail application requires a response from the opposing party, with further instructions to be sought from Yadav in jail.  Negotiations continue on a 2012 agreement, with clearer answers expected Monday.

title: How India's IT sector is ‚Äòuniquely positioned‚Äô to weather Trump's visa storm
content: Moody‚Äôs is of the view that most of these IT sector firms will be able to absorb the higher visa costs without a significant deterioration in their operating or financial profiles. India is in a unique position to bridge the talent gap that the US is facing. Moody‚Äôs explains that the US is set to face increasing labour shortages because of declining birthrates and a population that is fast aging.

title: Tendulkar celebrates Italy's win - 'Proud footballing nation making mark'
content: Sachin Tendulkar praised Italy‚Äôs historic first T20 World Cup win, calling it a proud moment for a footballing nation embracing cricket. Italy thrashed Nepal by 10 wickets at Wankhede, with spinners Kalugamage and Manenti restricting Nepal to 123 before Mosca brothers chased easily. Stand-in captain Harry Manenti called it a dream moment, while Nepal skipper Rohit Paudel credited Italy for their strong performance.

title: 1897 dinner menu reveals lavish feast hosted by Baroda royal for Gwalior Maharaja
content: A 1897 dinner menu from the Maharaja of Baroda to the Maharaja of Gwalior, discovered by historian Neha Vermani, reveals a fascinating blend of Indian royalty and European fine dining. Featuring French dishes like truffles and partridge alongside a vegetable curry, the menu highlights the sophisticated tastes and global influences of Indian elites, sparking widespread social media interest.

title: You spin me right round: Comet 41P's odd rotation stump astronomers
content: A rare event was observed as comet 41P/Tuttle-Giacobini-Kres√°k dramatically slowed its rotation and then spun in the opposite direction. This extreme change in spin, driven by material jets, was captured by Hubble and Swift telescopes. Astronomers believe this process may explain the rarity of smaller comets.

title: Tamil Nadu: Cong pushes back at Stalin's 'friends without benefits' line
content: Congress MP Manickam Tagore publicly challenged Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin's dismissal of power-sharing demands as a "conspiracy." Stalin firmly ruled out sharing governance with allies, asserting the DMK-Congress alliance remains intact. This public spat fuels speculation about the alliance's stability ahead of the 2026 elections.

title: Mega Rs 3.6L cr defence boost: Govt gives nod for 114 Rafale jets, missiles & P-8I aircraft
content: India's Defence Acquisition Council has approved the purchase of Rafale fighter jets from France for an estimated Rs 3.25 lakh crore. This significant procurement will see 80% of the jets manufactured in India, bolstering the Indian Air Force's fleet and addressing rising regional security concerns.

title: Happy Valentines Day 2026: Wishes, messages, quotes to share with your special someone
content: Valentine's Day, celebrated annually on February 14th, honours all forms of love, from romantic sparks to friendship cheers. In 2026, it falls on a Saturday, offering a perfect opportunity for connection.  Tracing its roots to ancient Roman festivals and medieval legends, the day has evolved into a global celebration of affection and appreciation.

title: No Abhishek Sharma vs Pakistan? Suryakumar Yadav's comment sparks panic
content: India's star opener Abhishek Sharma has been ruled out of the T20 World Cup clash against Namibia due to a stomach infection. Captain Suryakumar Yadav confirmed Sharma could also miss the upcoming match against Pakistan, with Sanju Samson replacing him in the lineup.

title: 'Amit Shah called me, then there was a raid': Cong's Bhupesh Baghel levels big charge
content: Former Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel claims Union home minister Amit Shah contacted him about ongoing cases, implying an offer to join the BJP. Baghel alleges the BJP uses investigative agencies against opposition leaders before offering a "washing machine" to cleanse them. He cited examples like Himanta Biswa Sarma and Ajit Pawar.

title: Italy register first-ever T20 World Cup win, thrash Nepal by 10 wickets
content: Italy achieved a historic maiden T20 World Cup victory, defeating Nepal by 10 wickets. After their spinners dismissed Nepal for 123, the Mosca brothers, Anthony and Justin, delivered a dominant unbeaten opening partnership to secure the win with 7.2 overs to spare.

title: Indian chess legend confirms participation for Norway Chess Women 2026 event
content: Indian chess legend Koneru Humpy will play Norway Chess Women for the third time from May 25 to June 5 in Oslo, expressing excitement about the competition and atmosphere. A trailblazer, she became India‚Äôs first female Grandmaster at 15 and crossed 2600 Elo in 2007. A two-time Women‚Äôs World Rapid Champion, she qualified for the 2026 Candidates.

title: America wants AI girlfriends, China wants AI boyfriends - here's why
content: In the US and much of the English-speaking internet, AI companions are overwhelmingly designed for men. The typical AI girlfriend is endlessly available, emotionally affirming, flirtatious on demand, and crucially programmable. She does not reject. She does not argue unless asked to. She does not leave.

title: Breezy Johnson engaged after 2026 Olympic Gold, Connor proposes
content: American skier Breezy Johnson experienced one of the most emotional days of her career at the Winter Olympics in Cortina d‚ÄôAmpezzo. Just days after winning the women‚Äôs downhill gold medal, the 30-year-old added a big personal milestone. Her boyfriend, Connor Watkins, proposed at the finish area of the super-G course.

title: 'Didn't abuse anyone': Priyanka rejects Rijiju's claim of Cong MPs misbehaving with Speaker
content: Priyanka Gandhi Vadra has vehemently denied Union minister Kiren Rijiju's claims that she encouraged Congress MPs to misbehave in the Lok Sabha Speaker's chamber.  She stated that no one was abused and that she was merely present, expressing her views peacefully. Rijiju had alleged that 20-25 Congress MPs verbally abused the Speaker and threatened the Prime Minister.

title: Afghanistan players withdraw from Pakistan Super League auction; here's why
content: Afghanistan cricketers withdrew from the Pakistan Super League (PSL) Players' Auction following backlash over Rahmanullah Gurbaz's direct signing by Peshawar Zalmi. Strained diplomatic relations between Pakistan and Afghanistan are cited as the primary reason for the players' decision to pull out, impacting their participation in the tournament.

title: Rs 260cr settlement for family of Indian student killed by US police officer ‚Äî what is the case?
content: The family of Jaahnavi Kandula, a 23-year-old Indian student killed by a speeding police officer in Seattle, has secured a $29 million settlement. Kandula was struck and killed by an officer driving 74 mph while responding to an emergency. The incident gained further outrage after another officer was heard laughing about the crash on body camera footage.

title: 'Used for terror, fraud': Russia blocks WhatsApp for defying local laws
content: Responding separately to Russian news agency TASS, Peskov indicated that the platform could be restored if its parent company complies with local regulations. "This is a matter of compliance with Russian laws. If Meta complies, it will enter into dialogue with the Russian authorities, and then there will be an opportunity to reach an agreement," he said.

title: Nate Diaz teases UFC return as White House card 2026 hypes fans
content: Nate Diaz has sparked fresh talk about a return to the Ultimate Fighting Championship. The American fighter posted a mysterious message on social media this week. His comments came as the UFC prepares for a historic event planned at the White House in June. Fans immediately began guessing whether Diaz could appear on the card.

title: Unsold in IPL, Steve Smith becomes PSL's costliest signing
content: Steve Smith shattered PSL records, becoming the most expensive player at PKR 14 crore for the Sialkot Stallions. The revamped 11th edition features a new auction system and two new franchises. Naseem Shah was the top Pakistani buy, while Babar Azam was retained. The tournament runs March 26-May 3.

title: Kim Jong Un's teenage daughter being positioned as successor, South Korea says
content: South Korea's intelligence agency believes Kim Jong Un is grooming his teenage daughter, Kim Ju Ae, as his successor, signaling a potential fourth-generation dynasty. Her increasing public appearances at key events, including military functions and a visit to a sacred mausoleum, suggest a formal designation is imminent. This marks a significant shift in North Korea's traditionally male-dominated leadership.

title: Once, twice or thrice? How many times do we really fall madly in love, study reveals
content: A new study from the Kinsey Institute surveyed over 10,000 Americans. It found that most people experience passionate love only twice in their lives. This finding contrasts with romanticized portrayals in media. The study suggests that while intense love is rare, companionate love is a more enduring form of connection. This information is relevant for singles navigating modern dating.

title: 'Voiced concern over social media addiction': 27-year-old YouTuber held for slitting father‚Äôs throat
content: A 27-year-old YouTuber allegedly murdered her father in Korba, Chhattisgarh, after a heated argument over her social media addiction and content creation. The incident, which also involved a land dispute, saw the daughter fatally attack her father with a sickle while he slept. Police have arrested the accused, with investigations ongoing.

title: No World Cup for 18 years to now four in a row: How 2019 changed Namibia cricket
content: From missing World Cups for nearly two decades to qualifying for four in a row, Namibia‚Äôs rise has been built on central contracts, homegrown talent and long-term planning. After losing their opening match, Gerhard Erasmus-led side will take on defending champions India on Thursday.

title: Rammed, flung, crushed: 24-year-old woman killed after drunk Haryana cop‚Äôs car mows her down
content: A 24-year-old Gurgaon-based professional, Nikita Bajaj, was killed in Ambala Cantonment after an e-rickshaw she was travelling in was hit from behind by a car allegedly driven at high speed by a police head constable. She was run over and declared dead at hospital. The accused was detained, and allegations of intoxication are under investigation.

title: Rajpal Yadav cheque bounce case: Actor to remain in jail, next hearing on Feb 16
content: Actor Rajpal Yadav has surrendered to Tihar jail and will continue to remain in jail. He failed to repay debts amounting to Rs 9 crore. The court refused his bail plea, citing a family wedding. Judicial procedure must be followed. Yadav's counsel argued for bail, proposing security deposit. The matter is listed for further hearing. Bollywood celebrities are supporting Yadav and pledging financial help.

title: Quote of the day by Lindsey Vonn: 'I‚Äôm never tired of winning'
content: Lindsey Vonn embodied resilience after a devastating Olympic crash, updating fans from hospital following her third successful surgery on a complex leg fracture. The 41-year-old, who had also ruptured her ACL days earlier, stressed that ‚Äúsuccess‚Äù now means recovery. After returning from retirement in 2024 and dominating World Cup races, Vonn‚Äôs comeback inspired fans and athletes alike. Her quote, ‚ÄúI‚Äôm never tired of winning,‚Äù reflects her relentless spirit and refusal to surrender to injury or doubt.

title: Cong's 'solo' gamble in West Bengal: Why decision to dump Left may be right
content: the Congress announced to go solo in all 294 seats in the upcoming assembly elections . in the 2021 assembly elections, the Congress could not win even one seat in the 294-member assembly . the party has broken its alliance with the left to take on the common enemy - the ruling Trinamool Congress and its leader Mamata Banerjee .
